name: mule
description: Mule Runtime and Integration Platform: Core components

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the flow to call

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameters.name: targetValue
parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operations.name: flowRef
operations.description: Allows a 'flow' to be referenced such that the message processing will continue in the referenced flow before returning. Message processing in the referenced 'flow' will occur within the context of the referenced flow and will therefore use its exception strategy etc.

parameters.name: idExpression
parameters.description: Defines one or more expressions to use when extracting the ID from the message. If this property is not set, '#[id]' will be used by default.

parameters.name: valueExpression
parameters.description: Defines one or more expressions to use when extracting the value from the message.

parameters.name: storePrefix
parameters.description: Defines the prefix of the object store names. This will only be used for the internally built object store.

parameters.name: objectStore
parameters.description: The object store where the IDs of the processed events are going to be stored. If defined as argument it should reference a globally created object store. Otherwise, it can be defined inline or not at all. In the last case, a default object store will be provided.

operations.name: idempotentMessageValidator
operations.description: Ensures that only unique messages are received by a service by checking the unique ID of the incoming message. Note that the ID used can be generated from the message using an expression defined in the 'idExpression' attribute. Otherwise, a 'DUPLICATE_MESSAGE' error is generated.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message that will be logged. Embedded expressions can be used to extract value from the current message. If no message is specified then the current message is used.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The logging level to be used. Default is DEBUG.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The log category to be used

operations.name: logger
operations.description: Performs logging using an expression that determines what should be logged. By default the current messages is logged using the DEBUG level to the 'org.mule.runtime.core.api.processor.LoggerMessageProcessor' category but the level and category can both be configured to suit your needs. message is specified then the current message is used.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Template to be processed.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location of the template. The order in which the transformer will attempt to load the file are: from the file system, from a URL or from the classpath.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameters.name: targetValue
parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operations.name: parseTemplate
operations.description: A transformer that parses a template defined inline.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The error type to raise.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of this error.

operations.name: raiseError
operations.description: Throws an error with the specified type and description.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: The variable name.

operations.name: removeVariable
operations.description: A processor that remove variables by name or regular expression.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The encoding of the value assigned to the payload.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to be set on the payload. Supports expressions.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: The mime type, e.g. text/plain or application/json

operations.name: setPayload
operations.description: A transformer that sets the payload with the provided value.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: The variable name.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The variable value.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: The encoding of the value assigned to the payload.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: The mime type, e.g. text/plain or application/json

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name that will be used to name the async scheduler

constructs.name: async
constructs.description: Processes the nested list of message processors asynchronously using a thread pool

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression to evaluate.

constructs.name: choice
constructs.description: Sends the message to the first message processor whose condition has been satisfied. If no conditions were satisfied, sends to the configured default message processor if configured, or throws an exception if not configured.

parameters.name: defaultResponseTimeout
parameters.description: The default period (ms) to wait for a synchronous response.

parameters.name: defaultTransactionTimeout
parameters.description: The default timeout (ms) for transactions. This can also be configured on transactions, in which case the transaction configuration is used instead of this default.

parameters.name: defaultErrorHandler-ref
parameters.description: The default error handler for every flow. This must be a reference to a global error handler.

parameters.name: shutdownTimeout
parameters.description: The time in milliseconds to wait for any in-progress work to finish running before Mule shuts down. After this threshold has been reached, Mule starts stopping schedulers and interrupting threads, and messages can be lost. If you have a very large number of services in the same Mule instance, if you have components that take more than a couple seconds to process, or if you are using large payloads and/or slower transports, you should increase this value to allow more time for graceful shutdown. The value you specify is applied to services and separately to dispatchers, so the default value of 5000 milliseconds specifies that Mule has ten seconds to process and dispatch messages gracefully after shutdown is initiated.

parameters.name: maxQueueTransactionFilesSize
parameters.description: The approximated maximum space in megabytes used by the transaction log files for transactional persistent queues. Take into account that this number applies both to the set of transaction log files for XA and for local transactions. If both type of transactions are used then the approximated maximum space used will be twice the configured value.

parameters.name: defaultObjectSerializer-ref
parameters.description: An optional reference to an ObjectSerializer to be used as the application's default

parameters.name: dynamicConfigExpiration
parameters.description: Configuration about how should the runtime handle the expiration of dynamic configurations

description.value: How many reconnection attempts to make

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

constructs.name: configuration
constructs.description: Specifies defaults and general settings for the Mule instance.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description:
The location of the file with the configuration properties to use. It may be a location in the classpath or an absolute location. The file location
 value may also contains references to properties that will only be resolved based on system properties or properties set at deployment time.

constructs.name: configurationProperties
constructs.description:
References a file with configuration properties. Each property has a key and a value. 
The key can be referenced from the mule configuration files using the following semantics: 
${key_name}. This allows to externalize configuration and change it based
on the environment the application is being deployed to.

parameters.name: when
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The full name of the error type to match against or a comma separated list of full names, to match against any of them.

parameters.name: logException
parameters.description: Determines whether the handled exception will be logged to its standard logger in the ERROR level before being handled. Default is true.

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Determines whether ExceptionNotifications will be fired from this strategy when an exception occurs. Default is true.

nestedComponents.name: onErrorContinue
nestedComponents.description: Error handler used to handle exceptions. It will commit any transaction as if the message was consumed successfully.

parameters.name: when
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The full name of the error type to match against or a comma separated list of full names, to match against any of them.

parameters.name: logException
parameters.description: Determines whether the handled exception will be logged to its standard logger in the ERROR level before being handled. Default is true.

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Determines whether ExceptionNotifications will be fired from this strategy when an exception occurs. Default is true.

nestedComponents.name: onErrorPropagate
nestedComponents.description: Error handler used to propagate errors. It will rollback any transaction and not consume messages.

nestedComponents.name: onError
nestedComponents.description: Error handler used to reference other ones.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The name of the error handler to reuse.

constructs.name: errorHandler
constructs.description: Allows the definition of internal selective handlers. It will route the error to the first handler that matches it. If there's no match, then a default error handler will be executed.

constructs.name: firstSuccessful
constructs.description: Sends a message to a list of message processors until one processes it successfully.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: An expression to that returns a java collection, object array, map or DOM nodes.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: An expression to that returns a java collection, object array, map or DOM nodes.

parameters.name: rootMessageVariableName
parameters.description: Property name where the parent message is stored.

parameters.name: counterVariableName
parameters.description: Property name used to store the number of message being iterated.

constructs.name: foreach
constructs.description: The foreach Processor allows iterating over a collection payload, or any collection obtained by an expression, generating a message for each element.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The name of the error handler to reuse.

constructs.name: onError
constructs.description: Error handler used to reference other ones.

constructs.name: roundRobin
constructs.description: Send each message received to the next message processor in the circular list of targets.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Sets a timeout in milliseconds for each route. Values lower or equals than zero means no timeout.

parameters.name: maxConcurrency
parameters.description: This value determines the maximum level of parallelism that will be used by this router. .

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameters.name: targetValue
parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

constructs.name: scatterGather
constructs.description: Sends the same message to multiple message processors in parallel.

parameters.name: transactionalAction
parameters.description: The action to take regarding transactions. By default nothing will be done.

parameters.name: transactionType
parameters.description: Transaction type supported. Availability will depend on the runtime version, though LOCAL is always available.

constructs.name: try
constructs.description: Processes the nested list of message processors, within a transaction and with it's own error handler if required.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of processing retries that will be performed.

parameters.name: millisBetweenRetries
parameters.description:
Specifies the minimum time interval between two process retries in milliseconds.
 The actual time interval depends on the previous execution but should not exceed twice this number.
 Default value is 60000 (one minute)

constructs.name: untilSuccessful
constructs.description: Attempts to route a message to the message processor it contains in an asynchronous manner. Routing is considered successful if no exception has been raised and, optionally, if the response matches an expression

messageSources.name: scheduler
messageSources.description: Source that schedules periodic execution of a flow.

description.value: Configuration about how should the runtime handle the expiration of dynamic configurations

Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute
A scalar time value for how often should the platform check for expirable dynamic configs
A time unit that qualifies the frequency attribute
